pdqninja.pdq
Interface Mergeable

All Known Implementing Classes:
PDQMap, PDQMultimap, PDQSet, PDQSortedMap, PDQSortedMultimap
public interface Mergeable

A class implements the Mergeable interface to indicate that its complete form can be constructed from smaller instances.

The cornerstones of the PDQ computation model is the ability to divide input data into smaller chunks that can be processed efficiently, and subsequently, the ability to merge smaller chunks of output to create complete data. The PDQ programming model further requires that the splitting of input, as well as merging of output, must be the responsibility of respective data structures, which frees the programmer from the need of rewriting their computation code.

The Mergeable interface indicates that the object can be constructed by merging multiple smaller instances. The process of merging is as follows: first, the library asks for objects (via the replicate() method) that will serve as containers for storing partial results; the library will execute some computation to process input and store partial results in these container object; and finally, the library will ask the class to merge these containers back (via the merge(Object...) method).

See Also:
Splittable

Method Summary
 void merge(Object... objects)
          Merge partial results.
 Object replicate()
          Provide an object that can serve as a container for storing partial results.
 

Method Detail

replicate

Object replicate()
Provide an object that can serve as a container for storing partial results.

The PDQ library can request a class implementing the Mergeable interface to generate these objects. This request can be made any number of times, and it is considered an error if null is returned.

Returns:
object that can server as a container for storing partial results.

merge

void merge(Object... objects)
           throws IOException,
                  InterruptedException
Merge partial results.

Note that the objects requested to be merged are the same objects that were generated via the replicate() method.

Parameters:
objects - objects containing partial results
Throws:
IOException
